newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire says rebel deal with U.S. mining firm void.
newsitem.headline: Zaire says rebel deal with U.S. mining firm void.

text.p: The Zaire government said on Thursday a $1 billion mining deal between Laurent Kabila's rebels and a U.S. firm for reactivating mines in Shaba province was invalid and stood revoked.

Information Minister Kin-kiey Mulumba said in a statement he read on national television that the the agreement with America Mineral Fields Inc contravened international law under which only a legal state could sign such a deal.
"In the case of American Mineral Fields of Mr Jean-Raymond Boulle, this company has willfully violated regulatory provisions dealing with contract negotiation and mining conventions," Kin-Kiey said.
"And by consequence the government revokes the contract between (state mining company) Gecamines and American Mineral Fields on the exploitation of Kipushi mines," he added.
The statement said the state retained control over mining contracts pending the outcome of ongoing negotiatons between the government and rebels on ending civil war.
The rebels, who seized the copper capital Lubumbashi earlier this month, have captured half of Zaire's territory including its most important mining regions, since taking up arms six months ago.
